images.copyright: Great grey owls in their nest, Finland (© imageBROKER.com/Alamy Stock Photo)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Great grey owls
images.desc: Silent hunters of the night sky, owls are among the most intriguing creatures in the animal kingdom. Their ability to turn their heads up to 270 degrees—combined with silent flight and exceptional night vision—showcases their remarkable adaptations. With over 200 species found across the globe, these birds contribute to ecological balance and are deeply woven into cultural traditions.

images.copyright: Sunflowers blooming in a field in summer (© Arsgera/Shutterstock)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Sunflowers
images.desc: Bright and bold, sunflowers are loved by bees, birds and just about everyone. The name of their genus, helianthus, comes from the Greek words for sun (helios) and flower (anthos). These annual plants are known for their large, daisy-like flowers and radiant charm. While sunflowers come in shades of red, orange and maroon, it's the classic yellow blooms with brown centres that are the most common.

images.copyright: Petroglyphs near Fruita in Capitol Reef National Park, Utah, United States (© Nicolas VINCENT/Adobe Stock)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Petroglyphs near Fruita in Capitol Reef National Park, Utah, United States
images.desc: There's something timeless about Capitol Reef National Park—a place where red rock cliffs, winding canyons and ancient stories come together under Utah's desert sky. Designated a national park in 1971, Capitol Reef invites reflection—not just on its vivid geology, but on the ancient narratives and cultural heritage etched into its landscape.

og.title: Petroglyphs near Fruita in Capitol Reef National Park, Utah, United States
og.desc: There's something timeless about Capitol Reef National Park—a place where red rock cliffs, winding canyons and ancient stories come together…

images.copyright: Royal Mile, Edinburgh, Scotland (© MEDITERRANEAN/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Royal Mile, Edinburgh, Scotland
images.desc: The Royal Mile, featured in today's image, is a historic street in Edinburgh, Scotland, stretching over one kilometre from Edinburgh Castle to the Palace of Holyroodhouse. This iconic route is made up of five connected streets, namely Castlehill, the Lawnmarket, the High Street, the Canongate and Abbey Strand. Along the way, visitors encounter major attractions such as St Giles' Cathedral, the Scottish Parliament Building and John Knox House.

og.title: Royal Mile, Edinburgh, Scotland
og.desc: The Royal Mile, featured in today's image, is a historic street in Edinburgh, Scotland, stretching over one kilometre from Edinburgh Castle…

images.copyright: Kalalau Beach on the Nā Pali Coast, Kauai, Hawaii, United States (© Russ Bishop/DanitaDelimont.com)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Kalalau Beach on the Nā Pali Coast, Kauai, Hawaii, United States
images.desc: No road signs, no souvenir stands—just 18 kilometres of mud, cliffs and sweeping views leading to one of Hawaii's most remote beaches. Kalalau Beach, at the end of Kauai's Kalalau Trail, is where tired feet meet a sandy reward. The only land access is the trail itself, a rugged trek through valleys and along coastal cliffs. During summer, some arrive by kayak, but all visitors need permits to stay.

og.title: Kalalau Beach on the Nā Pali Coast, Kauai, Hawaii, United States
og.desc: No road signs, no souvenir stands—just 18 kilometres of mud, cliffs and sweeping views leading to one of Hawaii's most remote beaches…

images.copyright: Ribadesella, Asturias, Spain (© Agnieszka Glowala/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Ribadesella, Asturias, Spain
images.desc: Ribadesella, featured in today's image, is an 84-square-kilometre municipality in northern Spain's Asturias region, known for its coastal charm and rich heritage. This historic town was founded in the 13th century by Alfonso X the Wise. Its rugged yet beautiful coastline includes beaches such as Santa Marina and Guadamía, where sea and mountains merge in striking landscapes. Nearby, the Tito Bustillo Cave, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offers a journey into the past with cave paintings dating back more than 14,000 years.

images.copyright: Female Bengal tiger, Kanha National Park, India (© Axel Gomille/Nature Picture Library)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Bengal tiger, India
images.desc: Think you can hear silence? Try sitting in a jeep in Kanha National Park in the heart of India, waiting for a Bengal tiger to appear. These cats are more than their unmistakable orange coats and black stripes. They are apex predators, essential to the health and balance of the ecosystems they inhabit. By keeping prey populations like deer and wild boar in check, tigers help shape vegetation patterns and support the overall biodiversity of their environments.

images.copyright: Yurts in the grassland of Mongolia (© Michel Arnault/Shutterstock)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Yurts in Mongolia
images.desc: Mongolia's vast grassland, featured today, is an ecoregion in East Asia. These ecosystems are among the largest intact temperate grasslands on Earth, stretching across millions of hectares of open steppe. They support around 200,000 nomadic herder families and provide habitat for rare species like the Mongolian gazelle and snow leopard.
